page.title: 12MIXED FARM, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: In{South Willingham}there is a farm which is less specialised than most others in the block. This farm covers 306 acres, of which 119 are under{ {wheat,}36 under{winter barley,}28 under{spring barley,}27 under{sugar {beet,}43 under{rape,}and 18 under{ {seed hay.}Three{cows}are kept for milking, surplus milk being used for { {butter.} In addition, 160 {bulls}are kept in the crew-yard,being fed on concentrates and rolled barley. Twenty five{sows}have about 100 piglets, kept for fattening, and there are about 40{ {sheep.}There are about 100 laying{hens producing 60{eggs}per day in season. There are also up to 4,000{chicks}at various stages of development; 200 { {geese;}several hundred{pheasants,}sold as 6 week poults; and{ducks}and{ {turkeys}kept for fattening. Jack Russell{dogs}are bred and sold.
